alert.note: Alert for Eastern Cherry; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 1:46AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Cherry County through 230 AM CDT... At 145 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Saint Francis to 8 miles southeast of Kilgore to near Merritt Reservoir. Movement was east-northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Valentine, Kilgore, Merritt Reservoir, Crookston, Anderson Bridge State Wildlife Management Area, Schlagel Creek State Wildlife Management Area and Highway 97 crossing the Niobrara River. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 170 and 214. Highway 97 between mile markers 112 and 141. Highway 83 between mile markers 197 and 222. Highway 12 between mile markers 1 and 15. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for north central Nebraska.
